(NYSE&#58; T) reported strong second-quarter results that demonstrate its ability to grow the right way by attracting high-quality 5G and fiber subscribers, while growing service revenues, resulting in improved consolidated revenues and earnings growth.</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#242424;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">&#8220;We are winning in a highly competitive marketplace, with the nation&#8217;s largest wireless and fiber networks. Customers are increasingly choosing AT&#38;T because we have the best technology and options for wireless and broadband connectivity, backed by the AT&#38;T Guarantee,&#8221; said </font><font style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#242424;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:15.00pt">John Stankey, AT&#38;T Chairman and CEO</font><font style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#242424;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">. &#8220;The milestones achieved this quarter &#8211; from passing more than 30 million customer locations with fiber and eclipsing 1 million total AT&#38;T Internet Air customers, to our agreement to acquire substantially all of Lumen&#8217;s Mass Markets fiber business - strengthen the industry's best and leading connectivity portfolio.&#8221;</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:4pt"><font $30.8 billion</font></div><div style="padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans $0.62</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">, versus $0.49 a year ago&#59; </font><font id="i8b993b2be0a04f19b1bbe09e106fbc68_4"></div><div><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:8pt"><font style="color:#009fdb;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:700;line-height:15.00pt">Impact of Tax Provisions in the One Big Beautiful Bill Act</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">AT&#38;T expects to realize $6.5 to $8.0 billion of cash tax savings during 2025-2027 relative to the guidance it provided at its 2024 Analyst &#38; Investor Day due to tax provisions in the One Big Beautiful Bill Act. This reflects estimated savings of $1.5 to $2.0 billion in 2025 and $2.5 to $3.0 billion in each of 2026 and 2027.</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div style="height:60.3pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">* Further clarification and explanation of non-GAAP measures and reconciliations to the most comparable GAAP measures can be found in the &#8220;Non-GAAP Measures and Reconciliations to GAAP Measures&#8221; section of the release and at investors.att.com.</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">&#169; 2025 AT&#38;T Intellectual Property. All rights reserved. AT&#38;T and the Globe logo are registered trademarks of AT&#38;T Intellectual Property.</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:112.86pt;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><img alt="earnings_bannersx2q2025x24.jpg" src="earnings_bannersx2q2025x24.jpg" style="height:136px;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:816px"></div></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">The Company intends to invest $3.5 billion of these savings into its network to accelerate its fiber internet build-out to a pace of 4 million locations per year, a run-rate it expects to achieve by the end of 2026. As a result of this increased pace of organic fiber deployment, AT&#38;T expects that by the end of 2030 it will reach approximately 50 million customer locations with its in-region fiber network and more than 60 million fiber locations when including the Lumen Mass Markets fiber assets it has agreed to acquire and plans to expand, its Gigapower joint venture, and agreements with other commercial open access providers</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:6.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt;position:relative;top:-3.5pt;vertical-align:baseline">1</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">.</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">AT&#38;T also intends to contribute $1.5 billion of these savings to its employee pension plan by the end of 2026, which would result in approximately 95% funding of the plan</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:6.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt;position:relative;top:-3.5pt;vertical-align:baseline">2</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">. The remaining tax savings will add to AT&#38;T&#8217;s financial flexibility to support additional strategic investments, incremental capital returns and debt repayment, among other potential uses.</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:8pt"><font style="color:#009fdb;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:700;line-height:15.00pt">Outlook </font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">AT&#38;T is updating certain elements of its financial guidance for 2025-2027 to reflect the impact of expected cash tax savings, as well as its year-to-date operating performance and outlook for the remainder of 2025. For the full year 2025, AT&#38;T expects&#58;</font></div><div style="padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans Black',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt;padding-left:12.96pt">Consolidated service revenue growth in the low-single-digit range.</font></div><div style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt;padding-left:12.96pt">Mobility service revenue growth of 3% or better.</font></div><div teens.</font></div><div style="padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans style="padding-left:72pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans Black',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">&#8226;</font><font range.</font></div><div style="padding-left:72pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt;padding-left:12.96pt">Consumer Wireline EBITDA* growth in the low-to-mid-teens range.</font></div><div style="padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans Black',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">&#8226;</font><font range.</font></div><div style="padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans through 2026 discussed above.</font></div><div style="padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:125%;padding-left:12.96pt">Share repurchases of $4 billion for 2025, including approximately $1.3 billion completed year to date.</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">AT&#38;T continues to operate the business to achieve the strategy outlined at its 2024 Analyst &#38; Investor Day. Accordingly, AT&#38;T reiterates its long-term financial outlook for&#58;</font></div><div style="padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans Black',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck style="padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans Black',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt;padding-left:12.96pt">Adjusted EBITDA* growth of 3% or better annually from 2026-2027.</font></div><div style="padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt;padding-left:12.96pt">Adjusted EPS* accelerating to double-digit percentage growth in 2027.</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">As a result of the cash tax savings from provisions in the One Big Beautiful Bill Act, AT&#38;T updates its financial outlook for&#58;</font></div><div style="padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans Black',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck All rights reserved. AT&#38;T and the Globe logo are registered trademarks of AT&#38;T Intellectual Property.</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:112.86pt;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><img alt="earnings_bannersx2q2025x24.jpg" src="earnings_bannersx2q2025x24.jpg" style="height:136px;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:816px"></div></div><div style="padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans Black',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt;padding-left:12.96pt">Free cash flow* of $18 billion+ in 2026 and $19 billion+ in 2027.</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:8pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:15.00pt">Note&#58;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt"> AT&#38;T&#8217;s second-quarter earnings conference call will be webcast at 8&#58;30 a.m. ET on Wednesday, July&#160;23, 2025. The webcast and related materials, including financial highlights, will be available at investors.att.com.</font></div><div id="i8b993b2be0a04f19b1bbe09e106fbc68_7"></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font style="color:#009fdb;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Consolidated Financial Results</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:3pt;padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans Black',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:15.00pt;padding-left:12.96pt">Revenues </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">for the second quarter totaled $30.8 billion, versus $29.8 billion in the year-ago quarter, up 3.5%. This was due to higher Mobility and Consumer Wireline revenues, partially offset by declines in Business Wireline and Mexico, which included unfavorable foreign exchange impacts.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:3pt;padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans Black',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:15.00pt;padding-left:12.96pt">Operating expenses</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt"> were $24.3 billion, versus $24.0 billion in the year-ago quarter. Operating expenses increased, primarily due to higher equipment costs associated with higher wireless equipment revenues, and higher network-related costs. Additionally, depreciation increased from our continued fiber investment and network upgrades, partially offset by lower impacts from our Open RAN network modernization efforts. These increases were partially offset by expense declines from restructuring costs in the year-ago quarter and continued transformation efforts.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:3pt;padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans Black',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:15.00pt;padding-left:12.96pt">Operating income</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt"> was $6.5 billion, versus $5.8 billion in the year-ago quarter. When adjusting for certain items, adjusted operating income* was $6.5 billion, versus $6.3 billion in the year-ago quarter.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:3pt;padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans Black',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:15.00pt;padding-left:12.96pt">Equity in net income of affiliates</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt"> was $0.5 billion, versus $0.3 billion in the year-ago quarter, reflecting cash distributions received by AT&#38;T in excess of the carrying amount of our investment in DIRECTV. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:3pt;padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans Black',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:15.00pt;padding-left:12.96pt">Net income</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt"> was $4.9 billion, versus $3.9 billion in the year-ago quarter. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:3pt;padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans Black',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:15.00pt;padding-left:12.96pt">Net income attributable to common stock </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">was $4.5 billion, versus $3.5 billion in the year-ago quarter. Earnings per diluted common share was $0.62, versus $0.49 in the year-ago quarter. Adjusting for $(0.08) which removes equity in net income of DIRECTV and excludes other items, adjusted earnings per diluted common share* </font><font style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">was</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt"> $0.54, </font><font style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">versus $0.51 in th</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">e year-ago quarter. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:3pt;padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans Black',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:15.00pt;padding-left:12.96pt">Adjusted EBITDA</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">* was $11.7 billion, versus $11.3 billion in the year-ago quarter. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:3pt;padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans Black',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:15.00pt;padding-left:12.96pt">Cash from operating activities</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt"> was $9.8 billion, versus $9.1 billion in the year-ago quarter, reflecting operational growth and higher distributions from DIRECTV, partially offset by higher cash tax payments.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:3pt;padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans Black',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:15.00pt;padding-left:12.96pt">Capital expenditures</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt"> were $4.9 billion, versus $4.4 billion in the year-ago quarter. </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:15.00pt">Capital investment</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">* totaled $5.1 billion, versus $4.9 billion in the year-ago quarter. Cash payments for vendor financing totaled $0.2 billion, versus $0.6 billion in the year-ago quarter. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:3pt;padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans Black',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:15.00pt;padding-left:12.96pt">Free cash flow,</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">* which excludes cash flows from DIRECTV, was $4.4 billion, versus $4.0 billion in the year-ago quarter. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:3pt;padding-left:36pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans Black',sans-serif;font-size:14pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:15.00pt;padding-left:12.96pt">Total debt </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">was $132.3 billion at the end of the second quarter, and </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:15.00pt">net debt</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">* was $120.3 billion.</font></div><div style="height:60.3pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">* Further clarification and explanation of non-GAAP measures and reconciliations to the most comparable GAAP measures can be found in the &#8220;Non-GAAP Measures and Reconciliations to GAAP Measures&#8221; section of the release and at investors.att.com.</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">&#169; style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:134%">1.1&#160;</font></td><td style="background-color:#ffffff;border-bottom:0.5pt solid Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:15.00pt">Mobility revenues</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt"> were up 6.7% year over year driven by </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:15.00pt">service revenue </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">growth of 3.5% from postpaid phone average revenue per subscriber (ARPU) growth and subscriber gains, as well as equipment revenue growth of 18.8% from higher wireless device sales volumes. </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:15.00pt">Operating expenses </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">were up 8.4% year over year due to higher equipment expenses driven by higher wireless sales volumes and the sale of higher-priced devices. This increase also reflects higher network costs, higher advertising and promotion costs, and increased depreciation expense. </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:15.00pt">Operating income </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">was $6.9 billion, up 3.2% year over year. </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:15.00pt">EBITDA</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">* was $9.5 billion, up $292 million year over year.</font></div><div style="height:60.3pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">* Further clarification and explanation of non-GAAP measures and reconciliations to the most comparable GAAP measures can be found in the &#8220;Non-GAAP Measures and Reconciliations to GAAP Measures&#8221; section of the release and at investors.att.com.</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">&#169; 2025 AT&#38;T Intellectual Property. Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:15.00pt">Business Wireline revenues</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt"> were down 9.3% year over year due to declines in legacy and other transitional services of 17.3%, partially offset by growth in fiber and advanced connectivity services of 3.5%. </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:15.00pt">Operating expenses </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">were down 3.0% year over year due to lower personnel and lower customer support costs associated with ongoing transformation initiatives, partially offset by higher depreciation expense due to ongoing investment for strategic initiatives such as fiber. </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:15.00pt">Operating income </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">was $(201) million, versus $102 million in the year-ago quarter, and </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:15.00pt">EBITDA</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">* was $1.3 billion, down $168 million</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Aptos',san-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt"> </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">year over year.</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:4pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:700;line-height:15.00pt">Consumer Wireline achieved strong broadband revenue growth driven by an 18.9% increase in fiber revenue growth. Consumer Wireline also delivered positive broadband net adds for the eighth consecutive quarter, driven by 243,000 AT&#38;T Fiber net adds and 203,000 AT&#38;T Internet Air net Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:15.00pt">Consumer Wireline revenues</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt"> were up 5.8% year over year driven by broadband revenue growth of 10.5% due to fiber revenue growth of 18.9%, partially offset by declines in legacy voice and data services and other services. </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:15.00pt">Operating expenses </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">were up 1.4% year over year, primarily due to higher depreciation expense driven by fiber investment, higher network-related costs, and higher marketing costs, partially offset by lower customer support, lower costs associated with transformation initiatives, and lower content licensing costs. </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:15.00pt">Operating income </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">was $335 million, versus $184 million in the year-ago quarter, and </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:15.00pt">EBITDA</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">* was $1.3 billion, up $195 million year over year.</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><table A </font></div><div style="height:60.3pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">* Further clarification and explanation of non-GAAP measures and reconciliations to the most comparable GAAP measures can be found in the &#8220;Non-GAAP Measures and Reconciliations to GAAP Measures&#8221; section of the release and at investors.att.com.</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">&#169; 2025 AT&#38;T Intellectual Property. All rights reserved. AT&#38;T and the Globe logo are registered trademarks of AT&#38;T Intellectual Property.</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:112.86pt;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><img alt="earnings_bannersx2q2025x24.jpg" src="earnings_bannersx2q2025x24.jpg" style="height:136px;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:816px"></div></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">discussion of factors that may affect future results is contained in AT&#38;T&#8217;s filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission. AT&#38;T disclaims any obligation to update and revise statements contained in this news release based on new information or otherwise.</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div id="i8b993b2be0a04f19b1bbe09e106fbc68_19"></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:14.00pt">Non-GAAP Measures and Reconciliations to GAAP Measures</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:14.00pt">Schedules and reconciliations of non-GAAP financial measures cited in this document to the most comparable financial measures under generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) can be found at investors.att.com and in our Form 8-K dated July&#160;23, 2025. Adjusted diluted EPS, adjusted operating income, EBITDA, adjusted EBITDA, free cash flow, and net debt are non-GAAP financial measures frequently used by investors and credit rating agencies. Prior periods for free cash flow and adjusted diluted EPS have been recast to conform to the current period presentation to remove cash flows and equity in net income from our investment in DIRECTV.</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:700;line-height:14.00pt">Adjusted diluted EPS </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:14.00pt">is calculated by excluding from operating revenues, operating expenses, other income (expenses) and income tax expense, certain significant items that are non-operational or non-recurring in nature, including dispositions and merger integration and transaction costs, actuarial gains and losses, significant abandonments and impairments, benefit-related gains and losses, employee separation and other material gains and losses. Non-operational items arising from asset acquisitions and dispositions include the amortization of intangible assets. While the expense associated with the amortization of certain wireless licenses and customer lists is excluded, the revenue of the acquired companies is reflected in the measure and those assets contribute to revenue generation. We also adjust for net actuarial gains or losses associated with our pension and postemployment benefit plans due to the often-significant impact on our results (we immediately recognize this gain or loss in the income statement, pursuant to our accounting policy for the recognition of actuarial gains and losses). Consequently, our adjusted results reflect an expected return on plan assets rather than the actual return on plan assets, as included in the GAAP measure of income. The tax impact of adjusting items is calculated using the adjusted effective tax rate during the quarter except for adjustments that, given their magnitude, can drive a change in the effective tax rate&#59; in these cases, we use the actual tax expense or combined marginal rate of approximately 25%. </font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:14.00pt">For</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:700;line-height:14.00pt"> 2Q25</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:14.00pt">, adjusted EPS of $0.54 is diluted EPS of $0.62 minus $0.05</font><font style="color:#ff0000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:14.00pt"> </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:14.00pt">equity in net income of DIRECTV and minus $0.03 benefit-related, transaction, legal and other items. For </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:700;line-height:14.00pt">2Q24</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:14.00pt">, adjusted EPS of $0.51 is diluted EPS of $0.49 adjusted for $0.05 restructuring and $0.01 benefit-related, transaction legal and other items, minus $0.04 equity in net income of DIRECTV. Transaction, legal and other costs include costs associated with legacy legal matters and the expected resolution of certain litigation associated with cyberattacks disclosed in 2024, which is presented net of expected insurance recoveries. The Company expects adjustments to 2025 reported diluted EPS to include a gain recognized on the sale of DIRECTV in 3Q25, an adjustment to remove equity in net income of DIRECTV (prior to the July 2, 2025 transaction close), a non-cash mark-to-market benefit plan gain&#47;loss, and other items. The Company expects the mark-to-market adjustment, which is driven by interest rates and investment returns that are not reasonably estimable at this time, to be a significant item. Our projected 2025-2027 adjusted EPS depends on future levels of revenues and expenses, most of which are not reasonably estimable at this time. Accordingly, we cannot provide reconciliations between these projected non-GAAP metrics and the most comparable GAAP metrics without unreasonable effort.</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:700;line-height:14.00pt">Adjusted operating income</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:14.00pt"> is operating income adjusted for revenues and costs we consider non-operational in nature, including items arising from asset acquisitions or dispositions. For </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:700;line-height:14.00pt">2Q25</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:14.00pt">, adjusted operating income of $6.5 billion is calculated as operating income of $6.5 billion minus $12 million of adjustments. For </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:700;line-height:14.00pt">2Q24</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:14.00pt">, adjusted operating income of </font></div><div style="height:60.3pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">* Further clarification and explanation of non-GAAP measures and reconciliations to the most comparable GAAP measures can be found in the &#8220;Non-GAAP Measures and Reconciliations to GAAP Measures&#8221; section of the release and at investors.att.com.</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">&#169; 2025 AT&#38;T Intellectual Property. All rights reserved. AT&#38;T and the Globe logo are registered trademarks of AT&#38;T Intellectual Property.</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:112.86pt;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><img alt="earnings_bannersx2q2025x24.jpg" src="earnings_bannersx2q2025x24.jpg" style="height:136px;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:816px"></div></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:14.00pt">$6.3 billion is calculated as operating income of $5.8 billion plus $520 million of adjustments. Adjustments for all periods are detailed in the Discussion and Reconciliation of Non-GAAP Measures included in our Form 8-K dated July&#160;23, 2025.</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:700;line-height:14.00pt">EBITDA </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:14.00pt">is net income plus income tax, interest, and depreciation and amortization expenses minus equity in net income of affiliates and other income (expense) &#8211; net. </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:700;line-height:14.00pt">Adjusted EBITDA</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:14.00pt"> is calculated by excluding from EBITDA certain significant items that are non-operational or non-recurring in nature, including dispositions and merger integration and transaction costs, significant abandonments and impairments, benefit-related gains and losses, employee separation and other material gains and losses.</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:700;line-height:14.00pt"> </font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:14.00pt">For </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:700;line-height:14.00pt">2Q25</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:14.00pt">, adjusted EBITDA of $11.7 billion is calculated as net income of $4.9 billion, plus income tax expense of $1.2 billion, plus interest expense of $1.7 billion, minus equity in net income of affiliates of $0.5 billion, minus other income (expense) &#8211; net of $0.8 billion, plus depreciation and amortization of $5.3 billion, minus adjustments of $21 million. For </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:700;line-height:14.00pt">2Q24</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:14.00pt">, adjusted EBITDA of $11.3 billion is calculated as net income of $3.9 billion, plus income tax expense of $1.1 billion, plus interest expense of $1.7 billion, minus equity in net income of affiliates of $0.3 billion, minus other income (expense) &#8211; net of $0.7 billion, plus depreciation and amortization of $5.1 billion, plus adjustments of $505 million. Adjustments for all periods are detailed in the Discussion and Reconciliation of Non-GAAP Measures included in our Form 8-K dated July&#160;23, 2025.</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:14.00pt">At the segment or business unit level,</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:700;line-height:14.00pt"> EBITDA</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:14.00pt"> is operating income before depreciation and amortization. </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:700;line-height:14.00pt">EBITDA margin</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:14.00pt"> is EBITDA divided by total revenues. </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:700;line-height:14.00pt">EBITDA service margin</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:14.00pt"> is EBITDA divided by total service revenues.</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:14.00pt">Adjusted EBITDA estimates for 2025-2027, and Mobility EBITDA, Business Wireline EBITDA and Consumer Wireline EBITDA estimates for 2025 depend on future levels of revenues and expenses which are not reasonably estimable at this time. Accordingly, we cannot provide reconciliations between these projected non-GAAP metrics and the most comparable GAAP metrics without unreasonable effort.</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:700;line-height:14.00pt">Free cash flow</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:14.00pt"> for </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:700;line-height:14.00pt">2Q25</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:14.00pt"> of $4.4 billion is cash from operating activities of $9.8 billion, less cash distributions from DIRECTV classified as operating activities of $0.5 billion, less cash taxes paid on DIRECTV of $0.3 billion, minus capital expenditures of $4.9 billion and cash paid for vendor financing of $0.2 billion. For </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:700;line-height:14.00pt">2Q24</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:14.00pt">, free cash flow of $4.0 billion is</font><font style="color:#ff0000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:14.00pt"> </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:14.00pt">cash from operating activities of $9.1 billion, less cash distributions from DIRECTV classified as operating activities of $0.4 billion, less cash taxes paid on DIRECTV of $0.1 billion, minus capital expenditures of $4.4 billion and cash paid for vendor financing of $0.6 billion.</font><font style="color:#ff0000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:14.00pt"> </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:14.00pt">Due to high variability and difficulty in predicting items that impact cash from operating activities, capital expenditures, and vendor financing payments, the Company is not able to provide reconciliations between projected free cash flow for 2025-2027 and the most comparable GAAP metrics without unreasonable effort.</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:700;line-height:14.00pt">Capital investment </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:14.00pt">provides a comprehensive view of cash used to invest in our networks, product developments, and support systems. In connection with capital improvements, we have favorable payment terms of 120 days or more with certain vendors, referred to as vendor financing, which are excluded from capital expenditures and reported as financing activities. Capital investment includes capital expenditures and cash paid for vendor financing ($0.2 billion in 2Q25, $0.6 billion in 2Q24). Due to high variability and difficulty in predicting items that impact capital expenditures and vendor financing payments, the Company is not able to provide reconciliations between projected capital investment for 2025-2027 and the most comparable GAAP metrics without unreasonable effort.</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div style="height:60.3pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">* Further clarification and explanation of non-GAAP measures and reconciliations to the most comparable GAAP measures can be found in the &#8220;Non-GAAP Measures and Reconciliations to GAAP Measures&#8221; section of the release and at investors.att.com.</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">&#169; 2025 AT&#38;T Intellectual Property. All rights reserved. AT&#38;T and the Globe logo are registered trademarks of AT&#38;T Intellectual Property.</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:112.86pt;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><img alt="earnings_bannersx2q2025x24.jpg" src="earnings_bannersx2q2025x24.jpg" style="height:136px;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:816px"></div></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:700;line-height:14.00pt">Net debt </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:14.00pt">of $120.3 billion at June 30, 2025, is calculated as total debt of $132.3 billion less cash and cash equivalents of $10.5 billion and time deposits (i.e. deposits at financial institutions that are greater than 90 days) of $1.5 billion.</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div id="i8b993b2be0a04f19b1bbe09e106fbc68_22"></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:15.00pt">For more information, contact&#58;</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">Brittany Siwald</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">AT&#38;T Inc.</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">Phone&#58; (214) 202-6630</font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:15.00pt">Email&#58; brittany.a.siwald&#64;att.com </font></div><div style="height:60.3pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">* Further clarification and explanation of non-GAAP measures and reconciliations to the most comparable GAAP measures can be found in the &#8220;Non-GAAP Measures and Reconciliations to GAAP Measures&#8221; section of the release and at investors.att.com.</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'ATT Aleck Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">&#169; <DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-99.3
<SEQUENCE>4
<FILENAME>t-2q2025exhibit993.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EX-99.3 DISCUSSION AND RECONCILIATION OF NON-GAAP MEASURES
<TEXT>
<html><head>
<!-- Document created using Wdesk -->
<!-- Copyright 2025 Workiva -->
<title>Document</title></head><body><div id="ieef297c94d7444e6936d4a22e559bd92_1"></div><div style="min-height:36pt;width:100%"><div><font><br></font></div></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Discussion and Reconciliation of Non-GAAP Measures  </font></div><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#160;</font></div><div style="text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">We believe the following measures are relevant and useful information to investors as they are part of AT&#38;T's internal management reporting and planning processes and are important metrics that management uses to evaluate the operating performance of AT&#38;T and its segments. Management also uses these measures as a method of comparing performance with that of many of our competitors. These measures should be considered in addition to, but not as a substitute for, other measures of financial performance reported in accordance with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP). Prior periods have been recast to conform to the current period presentation to remove cash flows and equity in net income from our investment in DIRECTV, which we sold to TPG Capital on July 2, 2025.</font></div><div style="text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div><div id="ieef297c94d7444e6936d4a22e559bd92_4"></div><div><font style="color:#00b0f0;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;text-decoration:underline">Free Cash Flow</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div style="text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Free cash flow is defined as cash from operations minus cash flows related to our DIRECTV equity investment (cash distributions minus cash taxes from DIRECTV), minus capital expenditures and cash paid for vendor financing (classified as financing activities). Free cash flow after dividends is defined as cash from operations minus cash flows related to our DIRECTV equity investment, capital expenditures, cash paid for vendor financing and dividends on common and preferred shares. Free cash flow dividend payout ratio is defined as the percentage of dividends paid on common and preferred shares to free cash flow. We believe these metrics provide useful information to our investors because management views free cash flow as an important indicator of how much cash is generated by routine business operations, including capital expenditures and vendor financing, and makes decisions based on it. Management also views free cash flow as a measure of cash available to pay debt and return cash to shareowners.</font></div><div style="margin-top:5pt"><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:100.000%"><tr><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:50.508%"></td><td Roman',serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;text-decoration:underline">Cash Paid for Capital Investment</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">In connection with capital improvements, we negotiate with some of our vendors to obtain favorable payment terms of 120 days or more, referred to as vendor financing, which are excluded from capital expenditures and reported in accordance with GAAP as financing activities. We present an additional view of cash paid for capital investment to provide investors with a comprehensive view of cash used to invest in our networks, product developments and support 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">(9,597)</font></td><td style="background-color:#dcdcdc;border-bottom:1pt solid #000;border-top:1pt solid #000000;padding:2px 1pt 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"></td><td style="background-color:#dcdcdc;border-bottom:1pt solid #000;border-top:1pt solid #000000;padding:2px 0 2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">$</font></td><td style="background-color:#dcdcdc;border-bottom:1pt solid #000;border-top:1pt solid #000000;padding:2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">(9,509)</font></td><td style="background-color:#dcdcdc;border-bottom:1pt solid #000;border-right:1pt solid #000;border-top:1pt solid #000000;padding:2px 1pt 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td></tr></table></div><div><font><br></font></div><div id="ieef297c94d7444e6936d4a22e559bd92_10"></div><div><font style="color:#00b0f0;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;text-decoration:underline">EBITDA</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div style="text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Our calculation of EBITDA, as presented, may differ from similarly titled measures reported by other companies. For AT&#38;T, EBITDA excludes other income (expense) &#8211; net, and equity in net income (loss) of affiliates, as these do not reflect the operating results of our subscriber base or operations that are not under our control. Equity in net income (loss) of affiliates represents the proportionate share of the net income (loss) of affiliates in which we exercise significant influence, but do not </font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">1</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:36pt;width:100%"><div><font><br></font></div></div><div style="text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">control. Because we do not control these entities, management excludes these results when evaluating the performance of our primary operations. EBITDA also excludes interest expense and the provision for income taxes. Excluding these items eliminates the expenses associated with our capital and tax structures. Finally, EBITDA excludes depreciation and amortization in order to eliminate the impact of capital investments. EBITDA does not give effect to cash used for debt service requirements and thus does not reflect available funds for distributions, reinvestment or other discretionary uses. EBITDA is not presented as an alternative measure of operating results or cash flows from operations, as determined in accordance with GAAP. </font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div style="text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">EBITDA service margin is calculated as EBITDA divided by service revenues.</font></div><div style="text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div><div style="text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">These measures are used by management as a gauge of our success in acquiring, retaining and servicing subscribers because we believe these measures reflect AT&#38;T's ability to generate and grow subscriber revenues while providing a high level of customer service in a cost-effective manner. Management also uses these measures as a method of comparing cash generation potential with that of many of its competitors. The financial and operating metrics which affect EBITDA include the key revenue and expense drivers for which management is responsible and upon which we evaluate performance. </font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div style="text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">We believe EBITDA Service Margin (EBITDA as a percentage of service revenues) to be a more relevant measure than EBITDA Margin (EBITDA as a percentage of total revenue) for our Mobility business unit operating margin. We also use wireless service revenues to calculate margin to facilitate comparison, both internally and externally with our wireless competitors, as they calculate their margins using wireless service revenues as well. </font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div style="text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">There are material limitations to using these non-GAAP financial measures. EBITDA, EBITDA margin and EBITDA service margin, as we have defined them, may not be comparable to similarly titled measures reported by other companies. Furthermore, these performance measures do not take into account certain significant items, including depreciation and amortization, interest expense, tax expense and equity in net income (loss) of affiliates. For market comparability, management analyzes performance measures that are similar in nature to EBITDA as we present it, and considering the economic effect of the excluded expense items independently as well as in connection with its analysis of net income as calculated in accordance with GAAP. EBITDA, EBITDA margin and EBITDA service margin should be considered in addition to, but not as a substitute for, other measures of financial performance reported in accordance with GAAP. </font></div><div style="text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div><div><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:100.000%"><tr><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:50.361%"></td><td Roman',serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#160;</font></td><td style="background-color:#dadada;padding:2px 1pt 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:top"></td><td colspan="2" Roman',serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">%</font></td></tr></table></div><div><font><br></font></div><div id="ieef297c94d7444e6936d4a22e559bd92_19"></div><div><font><br></font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">3</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:36pt;width:100%"><div><font><br></font></div></div><div><font style="color:#00b0f0;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;text-decoration:underline">Adjusting Items</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div style="text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Adjusting items include revenues and costs we consider non-operational in nature, including items arising from asset acquisitions or dispositions, including the amortization of intangible assets. While the expense associated with the amortization of certain wireless licenses and customer lists is excluded, the revenue of the acquired companies is reflected in the measure and that those assets contribute to revenue generation. We also adjust for net actuarial gains or losses associated with our pension and postemployment benefit plans due to the often-significant impact on our results (we immediately recognize this gain or loss in the income statement, pursuant to our accounting policy for the recognition of actuarial gains and losses). Consequently, our adjusted results reflect an expected return on plan assets rather than the actual return on plan assets, as included in the GAAP measure of income. </font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div style="text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">The tax impact of adjusting items is calculated using the adjusted effective tax rate during the quarter except for adjustments that, given their magnitude, can drive a change in the effective tax rate, in these cases we use the actual tax expense or combined marginal rate of approximately 25%.</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">&#160;&#160;</font></div><div style="margin-top:5pt"><table id="ieef297c94d7444e6936d4a22e559bd92_22"></div><div style="text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div><div style="text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Adjusted Operating Income, Adjusted Operating Income Margin, Adjusted EBITDA, Adjusted EBITDA margin, Adjusted EBITDA service margin and Adjusted diluted EPS are non-GAAP financial measures calculated by excluding from operating revenues, operating expenses, other income (expense) and income tax expense, certain significant items that are non-operational or non-recurring in nature, including dispositions and merger integration and transaction costs, actuarial gains and losses, significant abandonments and impairments, benefit-related gains and losses, employee separation and other material gains and losses. Management believes that these measures provide relevant and useful information to investors and other users of our financial data in evaluating the effectiveness of our operations and underlying business trends.</font></div><div style="text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div><div style="text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">Adjusted Operating Income, Adjusted Operating Income Margin, Adjusted EBITDA, Adjusted EBITDA margin, Adjusted EBITDA service margin and Adjusted diluted EPS should be considered in addition to, but not as a substitute for, other measures of financial performance reported in accordance with GAAP. AT&#38;T's calculation of Adjusted items, as presented, may differ from similarly titled measures reported by other companies.</font></div><div style="text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div><div style="color:#00b0f0;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%;text-decoration:underline">Net Debt to Adjusted EBITDA</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div style="text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Net Debt to EBITDA ratios are non-GAAP financial measures frequently used by investors and credit rating agencies and management believes these measures provide relevant and useful information to investors and other users of our financial data. Our Net Debt to Adjusted EBITDA ratio is calculated by dividing the Net Debt by the sum of the most recent four quarters Adjusted EBITDA. Net Debt is calculated by subtracting cash and cash equivalents and deposits at financial institutions that are greater than 90 days (e.g., certificates of deposit and time deposits), from the sum of debt maturing within one year and long-term debt.</font></div><div style="margin-top:5pt"><table style="margin-bottom:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">As a supplemental presentation to our Communications segment operating results, we are providing a view of our AT&#38;T Business Solutions results which includes both wireless and fixed operations. This combined view presents a complete profile of the entire business customer relationship and underscores the importance of mobile solutions to serving our business customers. Our supplemental presentation of business solutions operations is calculated by combining our Mobility and Business Wireline operating units, and then adjusting to remove non-business operations. The following table presents a reconciliation of our supplemental Business Solutions results. <a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="Show.toggleNext( this );">+ Details</a><div style="display: none;"><table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<tr>
<td><strong> Name:</strong></td>
<td style="white-space:nowrap;">dei_SolicitingMaterial</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="padding-right: 4px;white-space:nowrap;"><strong> Namespace Prefix:</strong></td>
<td>dei_</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong> Data Type:</strong></td>
<td>xbrli:booleanItemType</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong> Balance Type:</strong></td>
<td>na</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td><strong> Period Type:</strong></td>
<td>duration</td>
</tr>
</table></div>
</div></td></tr>
</table>

<TYPE>XML
<SEQUENCE>12
<FILENAME>Show.js
<DESCRIPTION>IDEA: XBRL DOCUMENT
<TEXT>
// Edgar(tm) Renderer was created by staff of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.  Data and content created by government employees within the scope of their employment are not subject to domestic copyright protection. 17 U.S.C. 105.
var Show={};Show.LastAR=null,Show.showAR=function(a,r,w){if(Show.LastAR)Show.hideAR();var e=a;while(e&&e.nodeName!='TABLE')e=e.nextSibling;if(!e||e.nodeName!='TABLE'){var ref=((window)?w.document:document).getElementById(r);if(ref){e=ref.cloneNode(!0);
e.removeAttribute('id');a.parentNode.appendChild(e)}}
if(e)e.style.display='block';Show.LastAR=e};Show.hideAR=function(){Show.LastAR.style.display='none'};Show.toggleNext=function(a){var e=a;while(e.nodeName!='DIV')e=e.nextSibling;if(!e.style){}else if(!e.style.display){}else{var d,p_;if(e.style.display=='none'){d='block';p='-'}else{d='none';p='+'}
e.style.display=d;if(a.textContent){a.textContent=p+a.textContent.substring(1)}else{a.innerText=p+a.innerText.substring(1)}}}
</TEXT>
</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>XML
<SEQUENCE>13
<FILENAME>report.css
<DESCRIPTION>IDEA: XBRL DOCUMENT
<TEXT>
/* Updated 2009-11-04 */
/* v2.2.0.24 */

/* DefRef Styles */
.report table.authRefData{
	background-color: #def;
	border: 2px solid #2F4497;
	font-size: 1em;
	position: absolute;
}

.report table.authRefData a {
	display: block;
	font-weight: bold;
}

.report table.authRefData p {
	margin-top: 0px;
}

.report table.authRefData .hide {
	background-color: #2F4497;
	padding: 1px 3px 0px 0px;
	text-align: right;
}

.report table.authRefData .hide a:hover {
	background-color: #2F4497;
}

.report table.authRefData .body {
	height: 150px;
	overflow: auto;
	width: 400px;
}

.report table.authRefData table{
	font-size: 1em;
}

/* Report Styles */
.pl a, .pl a:visited {
	color: black;
	text-decoration: none;
}

/* table */
.report {
	background-color: white;
	border: 2px solid #acf;
	clear: both;
	color: black;
	font: normal 8pt Helvetica, Arial, san-serif;
	margin-bottom: 2em;
}

.report hr {
	border: 1px solid #acf;
}

/* Top labels */
.report th {
	background-color: #acf;
	color: black;
	font-weight: bold;
	text-align: center;
}

.report th.void	{
	background-color: transparent;
	color: #000000;
	font: bold 10pt Helvetica, Arial, san-serif;
	text-align: left;
}

.report .pl {
	text-align: left;
	vertical-align: top;
	white-space: normal;
	width: 200px;
	white-space: normal; /* word-wrap: break-word; */
}

.report td.pl a.a {
	cursor: pointer;
	display: block;
	width: 200px;
	overflow: hidden;
}

.report td.pl div.a {
	width: 200px;
}

.report td.pl a:hover {
	background-color: #ffc;
}

/* Header rows... */
.report tr.rh {
	background-color: #acf;
	color: black;
	font-weight: bold;
}

/* Calendars... */
.report .rc {
	background-color: #f0f0f0;
}

/* Even rows... */
.report .re, .report .reu {
	background-color: #def;
}

.report .reu td {
	border-bottom: 1px solid black;
}

/* Odd rows... */
.report .ro, .report .rou {
	background-color: white;
}

.report .rou td {
	border-bottom: 1px solid black;
}

.report .rou table td, .report .reu table td {
	border-bottom: 0px solid black;
}

/* styles for footnote marker */
.report .fn {
	white-space: nowrap;
}

/* styles for numeric types */
.report .num, .report .nump {
	text-align: right;
	white-space: nowrap;
}

.report .nump {
	padding-left: 2em;
}

.report .nump {
	padding: 0px 0.4em 0px 2em;
}

/* styles for text types */
.report .text {
	text-align: left;
	white-space: normal;
}

.report .text .big {
	margin-bottom: 1em;
	width: 17em;
}

.report .text .more {
	display: none;
}

.report .text .note {
	font-style: italic;
	font-weight: bold;
}

.report .text .small {
	width: 10em;
}

.report sup {
	font-style: italic;
}

.report .outerFootnotes {
	font-size: 1em;
}
</TEXT>

<SEQUENCE>15
<FILENAME>FilingSummary.xml
<DESCRIPTION>IDEA: XBRL DOCUMENT
<TEXT>
<XML>
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='utf-8'?>
<FilingSummary>
  <Version>3.25.2</Version>
  <ProcessingTime/>
  <ReportFormat>html</ReportFormat>
  <ContextCount>34</ContextCount>
  <ElementCount>22</ElementCount>
  <EntityCount>1</EntityCount>
